1→;;;; destructuring.lisp - Destructuring lambda-list parsing utilities
     2→;;;; Phase 9B - destructuring-bind macro support (031-destructuring-bind-macro)
     3→
     4→(in-package #:clysm/lib/destructuring)
     5→
     6→;;; ============================================================
     7→;;; Parsed Lambda-List Structure
     8→;;; ============================================================
     9→
    10→(defstruct parsed-lambda-list
    11→  "Intermediate representation of a destructuring lambda-list after parsing.
    12→   Stores all components extracted from the lambda-list pattern."
    13→  (whole-var nil :type (or null symbol))
    14→  (required-params nil :type list)
    15→  (optional-params nil :type list)
    16→  (rest-var nil :type (or null symbol))
    17→  (key-params nil :type list)
    18→  (allow-other-keys-p nil :type boolean))
    19→
    20→;;; ============================================================
    21→;;; Parameter Specification Structures
    22→;;; ============================================================
    23→
    24→(defstruct param-spec
    25→  "Represents a required positional parameter.
    26→   TYPE: :variable for simple symbols, :nested for nested patterns
    27→   VAR: The variable symbol (when type = :variable)
    28→   NESTED-LIST: A parsed-lambda-list (when type = :nested)"
    29→  (type :variable :type keyword)
    30→  (var nil :type (or null symbol))
    31→  (nested-list nil :type (or null parsed-lambda-list)))
    32→
    33→(defstruct optional-param-spec
    34→  "Represents an &optional parameter with optional default and supplied-p.
    35→   PARAM: The parameter (param-spec - variable or nested)
    36→   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied (default: nil)
    37→   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
    38→  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
    39→  (default-form nil :type t)
    40→  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))
    41→
    42→(defstruct key-param-spec
    43→  "Represents a &key parameter with keyword name, default, and supplied-p.
    44→   KEYWORD: The keyword symbol used in the plist (:foo)
    45→   PARAM: The variable or nested pattern (param-spec)
    46→   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied
    47→   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
    48→  (keyword nil :type (or null keyword))
    49→  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
    50→  (default-form nil :type t)
    51→  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))
    52→
    53→;;; ============================================================
    54→;;; Lambda-List Keyword Detection
    55→;;; ============================================================
    56→
    57→(defun lambda-list-keyword-p (item)
    58→  "Return true if ITEM is a lambda-list keyword."
    59→  (member item '(&whole &optional &rest &body &key &allow-other-keys)))
    60→
    61→;;; ============================================================
    62→;;; Parameter Parsing
    63→;;; ============================================================
    64→
    65→(defun parse-param (item)
    66→  "Parse a single required parameter.
    67→   ITEM: Either a symbol (variable) or a list (nested pattern).
    68→   Returns: A param-spec structure."
    69→  (cond
    70→    ((symbolp item)
    71→     ;; Simple variable
    72→     (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item))
    73→    ((listp item)
    74→     ;; Nested destructuring pattern
    75→     (make-param-spec :type :nested
    76→                      :nested-list (parse-destructuring-lambda-list item)))
    77→    (t
    78→     (error 'program-error
    79→            :format-control "Invalid destructuring parameter: ~S"
    80→            :format-arguments (list item)))))
    81→
    82→(defun parse-optional-param (item)
    83→  "Parse an &optional parameter specification.
    84→   Formats: var | (var) | (var default) | (var default supplied-p)
    85→   Where var can be a symbol or nested pattern.
    86→   Returns: An optional-param-spec structure."
    87→  (cond
    88→    ((symbolp item)
    89→     ;; Simple variable, no default, no supplied-p
    90→     (make-optional-param-spec
    91→      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
    92→      :default-form nil
    93→      :supplied-p nil))
    94→    ((listp item)
    95→     (let ((var-part (first item))
    96→           (default (second item))
    97→           (supplied-p (third item)))
    98→       (make-optional-param-spec
    99→        :param (parse-param var-part)
   100→        :default-form default
   101→        :supplied-p supplied-p)))
   102→    (t
   103→     (error 'program-error
   104→            :format-control "Invalid &optional parameter: ~S"
   105→            :format-arguments (list item)))))
   106→
   107→(defun parse-key-param (item)
   108→  "Parse a &key parameter specification.
   109→   Formats: var | (var default) | (var default supplied-p) |
   110→            ((keyword var) default) | ((keyword var) default supplied-p)
   111→   Returns: A key-param-spec structure."
   112→  (cond
   113→    ((symbolp item)
   114→     ;; Simple variable, keyword derived from name
   115→     (make-key-param-spec
   116→      :keyword (intern (symbol-name item) :keyword)
   117→      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
   118→      :default-form nil
   119→      :supplied-p nil))
   120→    ((listp item)
   121→     (let ((var-part (first item))
   122→           (default (second item))
   123→           (supplied-p (third item)))
   124→       (cond
   125→         ;; ((keyword var) ...) form
   126→         ((and (listp var-part) (= 2 (length var-part)))
   127→          (let ((keyword (first var-part))
   128→                (var (second var-part)))
   129→            (make-key-param-spec
   130→             :keyword (if (keywordp keyword)
   131→                          keyword
   132→                          (intern (symbol-name keyword) :keyword))
   133→             :param (parse-param var)
   134→             :default-form default
   135→             :supplied-p supplied-p)))
   136→         ;; (var ...) form
   137→         ((symbolp var-part)
   138→          (make-key-param-spec
   139→           :keyword (intern (symbol-name var-part) :keyword)
   140→           :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var var-part)
   141→           :default-form default
   142→           :supplied-p supplied-p))
   143→         ;; (nested-list default) form - not supported
   144→         ((listp var-part)
   145→          (error 'program-error
   146→                 :format-control "Nested patterns in &key require explicit keyword: ~S"
   147→                 :format-arguments (list item)))
   148→         (t
   149→          (error 'program-error
   150→                 :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
   151→                 :format-arguments (list item))))))
   152→    (t
   153→     (error 'program-error
   154→            :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
   155→            :format-arguments (list item)))))
   156→
   157→;;; ============================================================
   158→;;; Lambda-List Parsing (State Machine)
   159→;;; ============================================================
   160→
   161→(defun parse-destructuring-lambda-list (lambda-list)
   162→  "Parse a destructuring lambda-list into a parsed-lambda-list structure.
   163→   Uses a state machine as specified in data-model.md:
   164→   START -> AFTER-WHOLE -> REQUIRED -> OPTIONAL -> REST -> KEY -> ALLOW-KEYS -> END
   165→
   166→   Signals PROGRAM-ERROR for:
   167→   - Invalid lambda-list keywords
   168→   - Keywords in wrong order
   169→   - Duplicate keywords"
   170→  (let ((state :start)
   171→        (whole-var nil)
   172→        (required-params nil)
   173→        (optional-params nil)
   174→        (rest-var nil)
   175→        (key-params nil)
   176→        (allow-other-keys-p nil)
   177→        (remaining lambda-list))
   178→
   179→    ;; Handle dotted list case - convert to proper list with &rest
   180→    (when (and (listp remaining) (not (null remaining)))
   181→      (let ((last-cons (last remaining)))
   182→        (when (and last-cons (cdr last-cons) (not (listp (cdr last-cons))))
   183→          ;; Dotted list: (a b . c) -> (a b &rest c)
   184→          (setf remaining
   185→                (append (butlast remaining)
   186→                        (list (car last-cons) '&rest (cdr last-cons)))))))
   187→
   188→    (loop while remaining do
   189→      (let ((item (car remaining)))
   190→        (cond
   191→          ;; &whole - must be first
   192→          ((eq item '&whole)
   193→           (unless (eq state :start)
   194→             (error 'program-error
   195→                    :format-control "&whole must appear first in lambda-list"))
   196→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   197→           (unless remaining
   198→             (error 'program-error
   199→                    :format-control "&whole requires a variable name"))
   200→           (setf whole-var (car remaining))
   201→           (unless (symbolp whole-var)
   202→             (error 'program-error
   203→                    :format-control "&whole variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
   204→                    :format-arguments (list whole-var)))
   205→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   206→           (setf state :after-whole))
   207→
   208→          ;; &optional
   209→          ((eq item '&optional)
   210→           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
   211→             (error 'program-error
   212→                    :format-control "&optional in wrong position"))
   213→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   214→           (setf state :optional)
   215→           ;; Collect optional params until next keyword or end
   216→           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
   217→                 do (push (parse-optional-param (car remaining)) optional-params)
   218→                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
   219→           (setf optional-params (nreverse optional-params)))
   220→
   221→          ;; &rest or &body
   222→          ((member item '(&rest &body))
   223→           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional))
   224→             (error 'program-error
   225→                    :format-control "~S in wrong position" :format-arguments (list item)))
   226→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   227→           (unless remaining
   228→             (error 'program-error
   229→                    :format-control "~S requires a variable name" :format-arguments (list item)))
   230→           (setf rest-var (car remaining))
   231→           (unless (symbolp rest-var)
   232→             (error 'program-error
   233→                    :format-control "~S variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
   234→                    :format-arguments (list item rest-var)))
   235→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   236→           (setf state :rest))
   237→
   238→          ;; &key
   239→          ((eq item '&key)
   240→           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional :rest))
   241→             (error 'program-error
   242→                    :format-control "&key in wrong position"))
   243→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   244→           (setf state :key)
   245→           ;; Collect key params until next keyword or end
   246→           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
   247→                 do (push (parse-key-param (car remaining)) key-params)
   248→                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
   249→           (setf key-params (nreverse key-params)))
   250→
   251→          ;; &allow-other-keys
   252→          ((eq item '&allow-other-keys)
   253→           (unless (eq state :key)
   254→             (error 'program-error
   255→                    :format-control "&allow-other-keys must follow &key"))
   256→           (setf allow-other-keys-p t)
   257→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   258→           (setf state :allow-keys))
   259→
   260→          ;; Regular parameter (required)
   261→          ((not (lambda-list-keyword-p item))
   262→           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
   263→             (error 'program-error
   264→                    :format-control "Required parameter ~S in wrong position"
   265→                    :format-arguments (list item)))
   266→           (push (parse-param item) required-params)
   267→           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
   268→           (setf state :required))
   269→
   270→          ;; Unknown lambda-list keyword
   271→          (t
   272→           (error 'program-error
   273→                  :format-control "Unknown lambda-list keyword: ~S"
   274→                  :format-arguments (list item))))))
   275→
   276→    (make-parsed-lambda-list
   277→     :whole-var whole-var
   278→     :required-params (nreverse required-params)
   279→     :optional-params optional-params
   280→     :rest-var rest-var
   281→     :key-params key-params
   282→     :allow-other-keys-p allow-other-keys-p)))
   283→
   284→;;; ============================================================
   285→;;; Code Generation (Outside-In with List Threading)
   286→;;; ============================================================
   287→
   288→(defun generate-destructuring-code (parsed-ll list-form body)
   289→  "Generate code to destructure LIST-FORM according to PARSED-LL.
   290→   Returns a form that binds all variables and evaluates BODY.
   291→
   292→   PARSED-LL: A parsed-lambda-list structure
   293→   LIST-FORM: The form to destructure (usually a gensym-bound variable)
   294→   BODY: The body forms to evaluate after binding
   295→
   296→   Code generation works OUTSIDE-IN:
   297→   1. &whole binding (outermost)
   298→   2. Required bindings (consume from list, pass remainder)
   299→   3. &optional bindings (consume from remainder, pass new remainder)
   300→   4. &rest/&body binding (bind to final remainder)
   301→   5. &key bindings (extract from plist in &rest or remaining)"
   302→  (let* ((whole-var (parsed-lambda-list-whole-var parsed-ll))
   303→         (required (parsed-lambda-list-required-params parsed-ll))
   304→         (optional (parsed-lambda-list-optional-params parsed-ll))
   305→         (rest-var (parsed-lambda-list-rest-var parsed-ll))
   306→         (key-params (parsed-lambda-list-key-params parsed-ll))
   307→         (allow-other-keys-p (parsed-lambda-list-allow-other-keys-p parsed-ll))
   308→         (initial-list (gensym "LIST-"))
   309→         (has-rest-or-key-p (or rest-var key-params))
   310→         (has-more-p (or optional rest-var key-params)))
   311→
   312→    ;; Build the innermost continuation (body + &key if present)
   313→    (labels ((make-final-code (final-list-var)
   314→               ;; Generate the innermost code: &key bindings around body
   315→               (if key-params
   316→                   (generate-key-bindings key-params final-list-var
   317→                                          allow-other-keys-p body)
   318→                   (cons 'progn body)))
   319→
   320→             (wrap-rest (list-var continuation-fn)
   321→               ;; Wrap with &rest binding, passing bound var to continuation
   322→               (if rest-var
   323→                   `(let ((,rest-var ,list-var))
   324→                      ,(funcall continuation-fn rest-var))
   325→                   (funcall continuation-fn list-var)))
   326→
   327→             (generate-optional-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
   328→               ;; Generate optional bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
   329→               (if (null params)
   330→                   (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn)
   331→                   (let* ((param (first params))
   332→                          (remaining (rest params))
   333→                          (pspec (optional-param-spec-param param))
   334→                          (default (optional-param-spec-default-form param))
   335→                          (supplied-p (optional-param-spec-supplied-p param))
   336→                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
   337→                     (case (param-spec-type pspec)
   338→                       (:variable
   339→                        (let ((var (param-spec-var pspec)))
   340→                          (if supplied-p
   341→                              `(if (consp ,list-var)
   342→                                   (let ((,var (car ,list-var))
   343→                                         (,supplied-p t)
   344→                                         (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
   345→                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
   346→                                   (let ((,var ,default)
   347→                                         (,supplied-p nil)
   348→                                         (,next-var nil))
   349→                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))
   350→                              `(let* ((,var (if (consp ,list-var) (car ,list-var) ,default))
   351→                                      (,next-var (if (consp ,list-var) (cdr ,list-var) nil)))
   352→                                 ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))
   353→                       (:nested
   354→                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
   355→                          `(if (consp ,list-var)
   356→                               (let ((,elem-var (car ,list-var))
   357→                                     (,next-var (cdr ,list-var))
   358→                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p t))))
   359→                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
   360→                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
   361→                                   elem-var
   362→                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))))
   363→                               (let ((,elem-var ,default)
   364→                                     (,next-var nil)
   365→                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p nil))))
   366→                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
   367→                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
   368→                                   elem-var
   369→                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))))))))
   370→
   371→             (generate-required-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
   372→               ;; Generate required bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
   373→               (if (null params)
   374→                   ;; All required consumed - continue to optional/rest/key or check excess
   375→                   (if has-more-p
   376→                       ;; Has optional/rest/key - continue processing
   377→                       (if optional
   378→                           (generate-optional-chain optional list-var continuation-fn)
   379→                           (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn))
   380→                       ;; No optional/rest/key - check for excess elements
   381→                       `(if (consp ,list-var)
   382→                            (error 'program-error
   383→                                   :format-control "Too many elements for destructuring")
   384→                            ,(funcall continuation-fn list-var)))
   385→                   (let* ((param (first params))
   386→                          (remaining (rest params))
   387→                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
   388→                     (case (param-spec-type param)
   389→                       (:variable
   390→                        `(if (consp ,list-var)
   391→                             (let ((,(param-spec-var param) (car ,list-var))
   392→                                   (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
   393→                               ,(generate-required-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
   394→                             (error 'program-error
   395→                                    :format-control "Too few elements for destructuring: expected ~A"
   396→                                    :format-arguments (list ',(param-spec-var param)))))
   397→                       (:nested
   398→                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
   399→                          `(if (consp ,list-var)
   400→                               (let ((,elem-var (car ,list-var))
   401→                                     (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
   402→                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
   403→                                   (param-spec-nested-list param)
   404→                                   elem-var
   405→                                   (list (generate-required-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))))
   406→                               (error 'program-error
   407→                                      :format-control "Too few elements for destructuring")))))))))
   408→
   409→      ;; Build the code by chaining phases
   410→      (let ((core-code
   411→              (cond
   412→                ;; Has required params - start chain from required
   413→                (required
   414→                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
   415→                    ,(generate-required-chain required initial-list #'make-final-code)))
   416→                ;; No required, but has optional
   417→                (optional
   418→                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
   419→                    ,(generate-optional-chain optional initial-list #'make-final-code)))
   420→                ;; No required or optional - just rest/key
   421→                (t
   422→                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
   423→                    ,(wrap-rest initial-list #'make-final-code))))))
   424→
   425→        ;; Wrap with &whole binding
   426→        (if whole-var
   427→            `(let ((,whole-var ,list-form))
   428→               ,core-code)
   429→            core-code)))))
   430→
   431→(defun generate-key-bindings (params list-var allow-other-keys-p body)
   432→  "Generate code to bind keyword parameters from LIST-VAR (plist).
   433→   PARAMS: List of key-param-spec structures
   434→   LIST-VAR: Symbol naming the variable holding the plist
   435→   ALLOW-OTHER-KEYS-P: Whether to skip unknown key validation
   436→   BODY: Continuation after binding
   437→   Returns: Code that extracts keyword values from plist."
   438→  (if (null params)
   439→      ;; All keys bound - continue to body
   440→      ;; TODO: Add unknown key validation when allow-other-keys-p is nil
   441→      (cons 'progn body)
   442→      (let* ((param (first params))
   443→             (remaining (rest params))
   444→             (keyword (key-param-spec-keyword param))
   445→             (pspec (key-param-spec-param param))
   446→             (default (key-param-spec-default-form param))
   447→             (supplied-p (key-param-spec-supplied-p param))
   448→             (found-var (gensym "FOUND-"))
   449→             (val-var (gensym "VAL-")))
   450→        (case (param-spec-type pspec)
   451→          (:variable
   452→           (let ((var (param-spec-var pspec)))
   453→             (if supplied-p
   454→                 `(let* ((,found-var (getf ,list-var ,keyword '%not-found%))
   455→                         (,supplied-p (not (eq ,found-var '%not-found%)))
   456→                         (,var (if ,supplied-p ,found-var ,default)))
   457→                    ,(generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body))
   458→                 `(let ((,var (getf ,list-var ,keyword ,default)))
   459→                    ,(generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body)))))
   460→          (:nested
   461→           `(let* ((,found-var (getf ,list-var ,keyword '%not-found%))
   462→                   ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p (not (eq ,found-var '%not-found%)))))
   463→                   (,val-var (if (eq ,found-var '%not-found%) ,default ,found-var)))
   464→              ,(generate-destructuring-code
   465→                (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
   466→                val-var
   467→                (list (generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body)))))))))
   468→

;;;; destructuring.lisp - Destructuring lambda-list parsing utilities
;;;; Phase 9B - destructuring-bind macro support (031-destructuring-bind-macro)

(in-package #:clysm/lib/destructuring)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Parsed Lambda-List Structure
;;; ============================================================

(defstruct parsed-lambda-list
  "Intermediate representation of a destructuring lambda-list after parsing.
   Stores all components extracted from the lambda-list pattern."
  (whole-var nil :type (or null symbol))
  (required-params nil :type list)
  (optional-params nil :type list)
  (rest-var nil :type (or null symbol))
  (key-params nil :type list)
  (allow-other-keys-p nil :type boolean))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Parameter Specification Structures
;;; ============================================================

(defstruct param-spec
  "Represents a required positional parameter.
   TYPE: :variable for simple symbols, :nested for nested patterns
   VAR: The variable symbol (when type = :variable)
   NESTED-LIST: A parsed-lambda-list (when type = :nested)"
  (type :variable :type keyword)
  (var nil :type (or null symbol))
  (nested-list nil :type (or null parsed-lambda-list)))

(defstruct optional-param-spec
  "Represents an &optional parameter with optional default and supplied-p.
   PARAM: The parameter (param-spec - variable or nested)
   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied (default: nil)
   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
  (default-form nil :type t)
  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))

(defstruct key-param-spec
  "Represents a &key parameter with keyword name, default, and supplied-p.
   KEYWORD: The keyword symbol used in the plist (:foo)
   PARAM: The variable or nested pattern (param-spec)
   DEFAULT-FORM: Expression evaluated if not supplied
   SUPPLIED-P: Variable bound to T/NIL indicating if supplied"
  (keyword nil :type (or null keyword))
  (param nil :type (or null param-spec))
  (default-form nil :type t)
  (supplied-p nil :type (or null symbol)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Lambda-List Keyword Detection
;;; ============================================================

(defun lambda-list-keyword-p (item)
  "Return true if ITEM is a lambda-list keyword."
  (member item '(&whole &optional &rest &body &key &allow-other-keys)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Parameter Parsing
;;; ============================================================

(defun parse-param (item)
  "Parse a single required parameter.
   ITEM: Either a symbol (variable) or a list (nested pattern).
   Returns: A param-spec structure."
  (cond
    ((symbolp item)
     ;; Simple variable
     (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item))
    ((listp item)
     ;; Nested destructuring pattern
     (make-param-spec :type :nested
                      :nested-list (parse-destructuring-lambda-list item)))
    (t
     (error 'program-error
            :format-control "Invalid destructuring parameter: ~S"
            :format-arguments (list item)))))

(defun parse-optional-param (item)
  "Parse an &optional parameter specification.
   Formats: var | (var) | (var default) | (var default supplied-p)
   Where var can be a symbol or nested pattern.
   Returns: An optional-param-spec structure."
  (cond
    ((symbolp item)
     ;; Simple variable, no default, no supplied-p
     (make-optional-param-spec
      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
      :default-form nil
      :supplied-p nil))
    ((listp item)
     (let ((var-part (first item))
           (default (second item))
           (supplied-p (third item)))
       (make-optional-param-spec
        :param (parse-param var-part)
        :default-form default
        :supplied-p supplied-p)))
    (t
     (error 'program-error
            :format-control "Invalid &optional parameter: ~S"
            :format-arguments (list item)))))

(defun parse-key-param (item)
  "Parse a &key parameter specification.
   Formats: var | (var default) | (var default supplied-p) |
            ((keyword var) default) | ((keyword var) default supplied-p)
   Returns: A key-param-spec structure."
  (cond
    ((symbolp item)
     ;; Simple variable, keyword derived from name
     (make-key-param-spec
      :keyword (intern (symbol-name item) :keyword)
      :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var item)
      :default-form nil
      :supplied-p nil))
    ((listp item)
     (let ((var-part (first item))
           (default (second item))
           (supplied-p (third item)))
       (cond
         ;; ((keyword var) ...) form
         ((and (listp var-part) (= 2 (length var-part)))
          (let ((keyword (first var-part))
                (var (second var-part)))
            (make-key-param-spec
             :keyword (if (keywordp keyword)
                          keyword
                          (intern (symbol-name keyword) :keyword))
             :param (parse-param var)
             :default-form default
             :supplied-p supplied-p)))
         ;; (var ...) form
         ((symbolp var-part)
          (make-key-param-spec
           :keyword (intern (symbol-name var-part) :keyword)
           :param (make-param-spec :type :variable :var var-part)
           :default-form default
           :supplied-p supplied-p))
         ;; (nested-list default) form - not supported
         ((listp var-part)
          (error 'program-error
                 :format-control "Nested patterns in &key require explicit keyword: ~S"
                 :format-arguments (list item)))
         (t
          (error 'program-error
                 :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
                 :format-arguments (list item))))))
    (t
     (error 'program-error
            :format-control "Invalid &key parameter: ~S"
            :format-arguments (list item)))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Lambda-List Parsing (State Machine)
;;; ============================================================

(defun parse-destructuring-lambda-list (lambda-list)
  "Parse a destructuring lambda-list into a parsed-lambda-list structure.
   Uses a state machine as specified in data-model.md:
   START -> AFTER-WHOLE -> REQUIRED -> OPTIONAL -> REST -> KEY -> ALLOW-KEYS -> END

   Signals PROGRAM-ERROR for:
   - Invalid lambda-list keywords
   - Keywords in wrong order
   - Duplicate keywords"
  (let ((state :start)
        (whole-var nil)
        (required-params nil)
        (optional-params nil)
        (rest-var nil)
        (key-params nil)
        (allow-other-keys-p nil)
        (remaining lambda-list))

    ;; Handle dotted list case - convert to proper list with &rest
    (when (and (listp remaining) (not (null remaining)))
      (let ((last-cons (last remaining)))
        (when (and last-cons (cdr last-cons) (not (listp (cdr last-cons))))
          ;; Dotted list: (a b . c) -> (a b &rest c)
          (setf remaining
                (append (butlast remaining)
                        (list (car last-cons) '&rest (cdr last-cons)))))))

    (loop while remaining do
      (let ((item (car remaining)))
        (cond
          ;; &whole - must be first
          ((eq item '&whole)
           (unless (eq state :start)
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&whole must appear first in lambda-list"))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (unless remaining
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&whole requires a variable name"))
           (setf whole-var (car remaining))
           (unless (symbolp whole-var)
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&whole variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
                    :format-arguments (list whole-var)))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :after-whole))

          ;; &optional
          ((eq item '&optional)
           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&optional in wrong position"))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :optional)
           ;; Collect optional params until next keyword or end
           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
                 do (push (parse-optional-param (car remaining)) optional-params)
                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
           (setf optional-params (nreverse optional-params)))

          ;; &rest or &body
          ((member item '(&rest &body))
           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional))
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "~S in wrong position" :format-arguments (list item)))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (unless remaining
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "~S requires a variable name" :format-arguments (list item)))
           (setf rest-var (car remaining))
           (unless (symbolp rest-var)
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "~S variable must be a symbol, got: ~S"
                    :format-arguments (list item rest-var)))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :rest))

          ;; &key
          ((eq item '&key)
           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required :optional :rest))
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&key in wrong position"))
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :key)
           ;; Collect key params until next keyword or end
           (loop while (and remaining (not (lambda-list-keyword-p (car remaining))))
                 do (push (parse-key-param (car remaining)) key-params)
                    (setf remaining (cdr remaining)))
           (setf key-params (nreverse key-params)))

          ;; &allow-other-keys
          ((eq item '&allow-other-keys)
           (unless (eq state :key)
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "&allow-other-keys must follow &key"))
           (setf allow-other-keys-p t)
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :allow-keys))

          ;; Regular parameter (required)
          ((not (lambda-list-keyword-p item))
           (unless (member state '(:start :after-whole :required))
             (error 'program-error
                    :format-control "Required parameter ~S in wrong position"
                    :format-arguments (list item)))
           (push (parse-param item) required-params)
           (setf remaining (cdr remaining))
           (setf state :required))

          ;; Unknown lambda-list keyword
          (t
           (error 'program-error
                  :format-control "Unknown lambda-list keyword: ~S"
                  :format-arguments (list item))))))

    (make-parsed-lambda-list
     :whole-var whole-var
     :required-params (nreverse required-params)
     :optional-params optional-params
     :rest-var rest-var
     :key-params key-params
     :allow-other-keys-p allow-other-keys-p)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Code Generation (Outside-In with List Threading)
;;; ============================================================

(defun generate-destructuring-code (parsed-ll list-form body)
  "Generate code to destructure LIST-FORM according to PARSED-LL.
   Returns a form that binds all variables and evaluates BODY.

   PARSED-LL: A parsed-lambda-list structure
   LIST-FORM: The form to destructure (usually a gensym-bound variable)
   BODY: The body forms to evaluate after binding

   Code generation works OUTSIDE-IN:
   1. &whole binding (outermost)
   2. Required bindings (consume from list, pass remainder)
   3. &optional bindings (consume from remainder, pass new remainder)
   4. &rest/&body binding (bind to final remainder)
   5. &key bindings (extract from plist in &rest or remaining)"
  (let* ((whole-var (parsed-lambda-list-whole-var parsed-ll))
         (required (parsed-lambda-list-required-params parsed-ll))
         (optional (parsed-lambda-list-optional-params parsed-ll))
         (rest-var (parsed-lambda-list-rest-var parsed-ll))
         (key-params (parsed-lambda-list-key-params parsed-ll))
         (allow-other-keys-p (parsed-lambda-list-allow-other-keys-p parsed-ll))
         (initial-list (gensym "LIST-"))
         (has-rest-or-key-p (or rest-var key-params))
         (has-more-p (or optional rest-var key-params)))

    ;; Build the innermost continuation (body + &key if present)
    (labels ((make-final-code (final-list-var)
               ;; Generate the innermost code: &key bindings around body
               (if key-params
                   (generate-key-bindings key-params final-list-var
                                          allow-other-keys-p body)
                   (cons 'progn body)))

             (wrap-rest (list-var continuation-fn)
               ;; Wrap with &rest binding, passing bound var to continuation
               (if rest-var
                   `(let ((,rest-var ,list-var))
                      ,(funcall continuation-fn rest-var))
                   (funcall continuation-fn list-var)))

             (generate-optional-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
               ;; Generate optional bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
               (if (null params)
                   (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn)
                   (let* ((param (first params))
                          (remaining (rest params))
                          (pspec (optional-param-spec-param param))
                          (default (optional-param-spec-default-form param))
                          (supplied-p (optional-param-spec-supplied-p param))
                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
                     (case (param-spec-type pspec)
                       (:variable
                        (let ((var (param-spec-var pspec)))
                          (if supplied-p
                              `(if (consp ,list-var)
                                   (let ((,var (car ,list-var))
                                         (,supplied-p t)
                                         (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
                                   (let ((,var ,default)
                                         (,supplied-p nil)
                                         (,next-var nil))
                                     ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))
                              `(let* ((,var (if (consp ,list-var) (car ,list-var) ,default))
                                      (,next-var (if (consp ,list-var) (cdr ,list-var) nil)))
                                 ,(generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))
                       (:nested
                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
                          `(if (consp ,list-var)
                               (let ((,elem-var (car ,list-var))
                                     (,next-var (cdr ,list-var))
                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p t))))
                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
                                   elem-var
                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))))
                               (let ((,elem-var ,default)
                                     (,next-var nil)
                                     ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p nil))))
                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
                                   (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
                                   elem-var
                                   (list (generate-optional-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn)))))))))))

             (generate-required-chain (params list-var continuation-fn)
               ;; Generate required bindings, passing final remainder to continuation
               (if (null params)
                   ;; All required consumed - continue to optional/rest/key or check excess
                   (if has-more-p
                       ;; Has optional/rest/key - continue processing
                       (if optional
                           (generate-optional-chain optional list-var continuation-fn)
                           (wrap-rest list-var continuation-fn))
                       ;; No optional/rest/key - check for excess elements
                       `(if (consp ,list-var)
                            (error 'program-error
                                   :format-control "Too many elements for destructuring")
                            ,(funcall continuation-fn list-var)))
                   (let* ((param (first params))
                          (remaining (rest params))
                          (next-var (gensym "REST-")))
                     (case (param-spec-type param)
                       (:variable
                        `(if (consp ,list-var)
                             (let ((,(param-spec-var param) (car ,list-var))
                                   (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
                               ,(generate-required-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))
                             (error 'program-error
                                    :format-control "Too few elements for destructuring: expected ~A"
                                    :format-arguments (list ',(param-spec-var param)))))
                       (:nested
                        (let ((elem-var (gensym "ELEM-")))
                          `(if (consp ,list-var)
                               (let ((,elem-var (car ,list-var))
                                     (,next-var (cdr ,list-var)))
                                 ,(generate-destructuring-code
                                   (param-spec-nested-list param)
                                   elem-var
                                   (list (generate-required-chain remaining next-var continuation-fn))))
                               (error 'program-error
                                      :format-control "Too few elements for destructuring")))))))))

      ;; Build the code by chaining phases
      (let ((core-code
              (cond
                ;; Has required params - start chain from required
                (required
                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
                    ,(generate-required-chain required initial-list #'make-final-code)))
                ;; No required, but has optional
                (optional
                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
                    ,(generate-optional-chain optional initial-list #'make-final-code)))
                ;; No required or optional - just rest/key
                (t
                 `(let ((,initial-list ,list-form))
                    ,(wrap-rest initial-list #'make-final-code))))))

        ;; Wrap with &whole binding
        (if whole-var
            `(let ((,whole-var ,list-form))
               ,core-code)
            core-code)))))

(defun generate-key-bindings (params list-var allow-other-keys-p body)
  "Generate code to bind keyword parameters from LIST-VAR (plist).
   PARAMS: List of key-param-spec structures
   LIST-VAR: Symbol naming the variable holding the plist
   ALLOW-OTHER-KEYS-P: Whether to skip unknown key validation
   BODY: Continuation after binding
   Returns: Code that extracts keyword values from plist."
  (if (null params)
      ;; All keys bound - continue to body
      ;; TODO: Add unknown key validation when allow-other-keys-p is nil
      (cons 'progn body)
      (let* ((param (first params))
             (remaining (rest params))
             (keyword (key-param-spec-keyword param))
             (pspec (key-param-spec-param param))
             (default (key-param-spec-default-form param))
             (supplied-p (key-param-spec-supplied-p param))
             (found-var (gensym "FOUND-"))
             (val-var (gensym "VAL-")))
        (case (param-spec-type pspec)
          (:variable
           (let ((var (param-spec-var pspec)))
             (if supplied-p
                 `(let* ((,found-var (getf ,list-var ,keyword '%not-found%))
                         (,supplied-p (not (eq ,found-var '%not-found%)))
                         (,var (if ,supplied-p ,found-var ,default)))
                    ,(generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body))
                 `(let ((,var (getf ,list-var ,keyword ,default)))
                    ,(generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body)))))
          (:nested
           `(let* ((,found-var (getf ,list-var ,keyword '%not-found%))
                   ,@(when supplied-p `((,supplied-p (not (eq ,found-var '%not-found%)))))
                   (,val-var (if (eq ,found-var '%not-found%) ,default ,found-var)))
              ,(generate-destructuring-code
                (param-spec-nested-list pspec)
                val-var
                (list (generate-key-bindings remaining list-var allow-other-keys-p body)))))))))

;;;; setf-expanders.lisp - Setf Expander Registry and Standard Expanders
;;;; Feature 028: Setf Macros and Generalized References

(in-package #:clysm/lib/setf-expanders)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Setf Expander Registry
;;; ============================================================

(defstruct setf-expander-registry
  "Registry mapping accessor names to setf expander functions.
   Each expander is a function: (form env) -> (values temps vals stores store-form access-form)"
  (table (make-hash-table :test 'eq) :type hash-table))

(defvar *global-setf-expander-registry*
  (make-setf-expander-registry)
  "Global registry for setf expanders.")

(defun register-setf-expander (registry name expander-fn)
  "Register EXPANDER-FN for accessor NAME in REGISTRY.
   EXPANDER-FN: (form env) -> (values temps vals stores store-form access-form)"
  (setf (gethash name (setf-expander-registry-table registry)) expander-fn))

(defun get-setf-expander (registry name)
  "Look up the setf expander for NAME in REGISTRY.
   Returns the expander function or NIL if not found."
  (gethash name (setf-expander-registry-table registry)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Setf Conditions (Error Types)
;;; ============================================================

(define-condition setf-error (error)
  ()
  (:documentation "Base condition for setf-related errors."))

(define-condition undefined-setf-expander (setf-error)
  ((accessor :initarg :accessor :reader undefined-setf-expander-accessor))
  (:report (lambda (c s)
             (format s "No setf expander defined for ~S"
                     (undefined-setf-expander-accessor c))))
  (:documentation "Signaled when no setf expander is defined for an accessor."))

(define-condition invalid-place (setf-error)
  ((place :initarg :place :reader invalid-place-place)
   (reason :initarg :reason :reader invalid-place-reason :initform nil))
  (:report (lambda (c s)
             (if (invalid-place-reason c)
                 (format s "Invalid place ~S: ~A"
                         (invalid-place-place c)
                         (invalid-place-reason c))
                 (format s "Invalid place: ~S"
                         (invalid-place-place c)))))
  (:documentation "Signaled when an invalid place is used in a setf form."))

(define-condition constant-modification-error (invalid-place)
  ()
  (:report (lambda (c s)
             (format s "Cannot modify constant: ~S"
                     (invalid-place-place c))))
  (:documentation "Signaled when attempting to modify a constant (nil, t, keywords)."))

(define-condition odd-argument-count (setf-error)
  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader odd-argument-count-macro)
   (argument-count :initarg :argument-count :reader odd-argument-count-count))
  (:report (lambda (c s)
             (format s "~S requires an even number of arguments, got ~D"
                     (odd-argument-count-macro c)
                     (odd-argument-count-count c))))
  (:documentation "Signaled when setf/psetf receives an odd number of arguments."))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Setf Expansion Protocol (Five-Value Tuple)
;;; ============================================================

(defun simple-variable-p (place)
  "Return T if PLACE is a simple variable (symbol that's not a constant)."
  (and (symbolp place)
       (not (keywordp place))
       (not (eq place t))
       (not (eq place nil))))

(defun get-setf-expansion* (place &optional env)
  "Return the setf expansion for PLACE.
   Returns five values:
     temps      - list of temporary variable symbols
     vals       - list of value forms for temps
     stores     - list of store variable symbols (usually 1)
     store-form - form that stores the value and returns it
     access-form - form that reads the current value"
  (declare (ignore env))
  (cond
    ;; Simple variable case
    ((simple-variable-p place)
     (let ((store (gensym "STORE-")))
       (values nil                           ; temps
               nil                           ; vals
               (list store)                  ; stores
               `(setq ,place ,store)        ; store-form
               place)))                      ; access-form

1→;;;; Macro System API Contracts
     2→;;;; These signatures define the public interface for macro operations
     3→
     4→;;; ============================================================
     5→;;; Macro Registry Operations
     6→;;; ============================================================
     7→
     8→;; Register a macro expander function
     9→;; registry: macro-registry
    10→;; name: symbol (the macro name)
    11→;; expander: function (form -> form)
    12→;; returns: expander
    13→(defun register-macro (registry name expander) ...)
    14→
    15→;; Get the macro function for a name
    16→;; registry: macro-registry
    17→;; name: symbol
    18→;; returns: function | nil
    19→(defun macro-function* (registry name) ...)
    20→
    21→;; Check if a form is a macro call
    22→;; registry: macro-registry
    23→;; form: any
    24→;; returns: boolean
    25→(defun macro-form-p (registry form) ...)
    26→
    27→;;; ============================================================
    28→;;; Macro Expansion
    29→;;; ============================================================
    30→
    31→;; Expand form once if it's a macro call
    32→;; registry: macro-registry
    33→;; form: any
    34→;; returns: expanded-form
    35→;; signals: macro-expansion-error (on invalid macro)
    36→(defun macroexpand-1* (registry form) ...)
    37→
    38→;; Repeatedly expand form until stable
    39→;; registry: macro-registry
    40→;; form: any
    41→;; returns: fully-expanded-form
    42→;; signals: macro-expansion-depth-exceeded (after 1000 iterations)
    43→(defun macroexpand* (registry form) ...)
    44→
    45→;; Recursively expand all macros in form and subforms
    46→;; registry: macro-registry
    47→;; form: any
    48→;; returns: fully-expanded-form (no macro calls remain)
    49→(defun macroexpand-all (registry form) ...)
    50→
    51→;;; ============================================================
    52→;;; Backquote Operations
    53→;;; ============================================================
    54→
    55→;; Expand a quasiquote form
    56→;; form: (quasiquote template)
    57→;; returns: list/quote/append form
    58→(defun expand-backquote (form) ...)
    59→
    60→;;; ============================================================
    61→;;; Defmacro Parsing
    62→;;; ============================================================
    63→
    64→;; Parse a defmacro form
    65→;; form: (defmacro name lambda-list . body)
    66→;; returns: defmacro-result struct
    67→;; signals: parse-error (on invalid syntax)
    68→(defun parse-defmacro (form) ...)
    69→
    70→;; Parse a macro lambda list
    71→;; lambda-list: list of parameters
    72→;; returns: (values required optional rest rest-kind keys allow-other-keys)
    73→;; signals: parse-error (on invalid lambda list)
    74→(defun parse-lambda-list (lambda-list) ...)
    75→
    76→;; Compile a parsed defmacro to an expander function
    77→;; result: defmacro-result
    78→;; returns: function (form -> expanded-form)
    79→(defun compile-defmacro (result) ...)
    80→
    81→;;; ============================================================
    82→;;; Standard Macros (Expansion Signatures)
    83→;;; ============================================================
    84→
    85→;; (when test &body body) => (if test (progn . body) nil)
    86→;; (unless test &body body) => (if test nil (progn . body))
    87→;; (cond &rest clauses) => nested if forms
    88→;; (case keyform &rest clauses) => nested if/eql forms
    89→;; (and &rest forms) => short-circuit conjunction
    90→;; (or &rest forms) => short-circuit disjunction
    91→;; (prog1 first &body body) => (let ((#:g first)) body... #:g)
    92→;; (prog2 first second &body body) => (progn first (prog1 second body...))
    93→;; (dolist (var list &optional result) &body body) => tagbody loop
    94→;; (dotimes (var count &optional result) &body body) => tagbody loop
    95→;; (do vars end-test &body body) => tagbody loop with parallel bindings
    96→
    97→;;; ============================================================
    98→;;; Error Conditions
    99→;;; ============================================================
   100→
   101→;; Signaled when macro expansion depth exceeds limit
   102→(define-condition macro-expansion-depth-exceeded (error)
   103→  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)
   104→   (depth :initarg :depth :reader expansion-depth)))
   105→
   106→;; Signaled when a macro call has wrong number of arguments
   107→(define-condition macro-argument-error (error)
   108→  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)
   109→   (expected :initarg :expected :reader expected-args)
   110→   (actual :initarg :actual :reader actual-args)))
   111→
   112→;; Signaled when referencing undefined macro
   113→(define-condition undefined-macro-error (error)
   114→  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)))
   115→

;;;; Macro System API Contracts
;;;; These signatures define the public interface for macro operations

;;; ============================================================
;;; Macro Registry Operations
;;; ============================================================

;; Register a macro expander function
;; registry: macro-registry
;; name: symbol (the macro name)
;; expander: function (form -> form)
;; returns: expander
(defun register-macro (registry name expander) ...)

;; Get the macro function for a name
;; registry: macro-registry
;; name: symbol
;; returns: function | nil
(defun macro-function* (registry name) ...)

;; Check if a form is a macro call
;; registry: macro-registry
;; form: any
;; returns: boolean
(defun macro-form-p (registry form) ...)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Macro Expansion
;;; ============================================================

;; Expand form once if it's a macro call
;; registry: macro-registry
;; form: any
;; returns: expanded-form
;; signals: macro-expansion-error (on invalid macro)
(defun macroexpand-1* (registry form) ...)

;; Repeatedly expand form until stable
;; registry: macro-registry
;; form: any
;; returns: fully-expanded-form
;; signals: macro-expansion-depth-exceeded (after 1000 iterations)
(defun macroexpand* (registry form) ...)

;; Recursively expand all macros in form and subforms
;; registry: macro-registry
;; form: any
;; returns: fully-expanded-form (no macro calls remain)
(defun macroexpand-all (registry form) ...)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Backquote Operations
;;; ============================================================

;; Expand a quasiquote form
;; form: (quasiquote template)
;; returns: list/quote/append form
(defun expand-backquote (form) ...)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Defmacro Parsing
;;; ============================================================

;; Parse a defmacro form
;; form: (defmacro name lambda-list . body)
;; returns: defmacro-result struct
;; signals: parse-error (on invalid syntax)
(defun parse-defmacro (form) ...)

;; Parse a macro lambda list
;; lambda-list: list of parameters
;; returns: (values required optional rest rest-kind keys allow-other-keys)
;; signals: parse-error (on invalid lambda list)
(defun parse-lambda-list (lambda-list) ...)

;; Compile a parsed defmacro to an expander function
;; result: defmacro-result
;; returns: function (form -> expanded-form)
(defun compile-defmacro (result) ...)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Standard Macros (Expansion Signatures)
;;; ============================================================

;; (when test &body body) => (if test (progn . body) nil)
;; (unless test &body body) => (if test nil (progn . body))
;; (cond &rest clauses) => nested if forms
;; (case keyform &rest clauses) => nested if/eql forms
;; (and &rest forms) => short-circuit conjunction
;; (or &rest forms) => short-circuit disjunction
;; (prog1 first &body body) => (let ((#:g first)) body... #:g)
;; (prog2 first second &body body) => (progn first (prog1 second body...))
;; (dolist (var list &optional result) &body body) => tagbody loop
;; (dotimes (var count &optional result) &body body) => tagbody loop
;; (do vars end-test &body body) => tagbody loop with parallel bindings

;;; ============================================================
;;; Error Conditions
;;; ============================================================

;; Signaled when macro expansion depth exceeds limit
(define-condition macro-expansion-depth-exceeded (error)
  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)
   (depth :initarg :depth :reader expansion-depth)))

;; Signaled when a macro call has wrong number of arguments
(define-condition macro-argument-error (error)
  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)
   (expected :initarg :expected :reader expected-args)
   (actual :initarg :actual :reader actual-args)))

;; Signaled when referencing undefined macro
(define-condition undefined-macro-error (error)
  ((macro-name :initarg :macro-name :reader macro-name)))

content.text:
## Clysm Macro System Exploration Report

I've completed a thorough exploration of the Clysm codebase macro system implementation. Here's the comprehensive summary:

---

## 1. Feature 016 Macro System Files

**Location**: `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp` (448 lines)

**Core Components**:
- `macro-registry` struct - hash-table mapping symbol → expander function
- `compile-env` struct - compile-time environment for macro expansion
- `macroexpand-1*` and `macroexpand*` - single-step and full expansion functions
- `parse-defmacro` - parses defmacro forms into defmacro-result structs
- `compile-defmacro` - generates macro expander functions
- Global `*global-macro-registry*` for standard macros
- Backquote expansion (`expand-backquote`, `expand-bq`, `expand-bq-list`)

**Related Files**:
- `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp` (lines 4923-4969) - `compile-macroexpand-1` and `compile-macroexpand` functions
- `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp` - Standard macro implementations (when, unless, cond, etc.)
- `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp` (lines 261-269) - AST node definitions for macroexpand

---

## 2. Current Macro Registry Structure

**Primary Registry** (macro.lisp lines 10-24):
```lisp
(defstruct macro-registry
  "Registry for macro functions."
  (table (make-hash-table :test 'eq) :type hash-table))
```

**Compile-Time Environment** (macro.lisp lines 51-54):
```lisp
(defstruct compile-env
  "Compile-time environment for macro expansion."
  (macros (make-macro-registry) :type macro-registry)
  (symbols (make-hash-table :test 'eq) :type hash-table))
```

**Access Functions**:
- `register-macro(registry name expander)` - stores macro
- `macro-function*(registry name)` - retrieves macro
- `macro-form-p(registry form)` - tests if form is a macro call

**Global Registry**: `*global-macro-registry*` (line 415) - single compile-time instance

---

## 3. Current Lambda-List Parsing

**Location**: macro.lisp lines 310-372

**Current Implementation** (NO &whole/&environment):
```lisp
(defun parse-lambda-list (lambda-list)
  ;; Returns: (values required optional rest-var rest-kind keys allow-other-keys)
  ;; Supports: &optional, &rest, &body, &key, &allow-other-keys
```

**Supported Parameters**:
- **Required**: plain symbols
- **&optional**: `var | (var default)`
- **&rest**/**&body**: single variable
- **&key**: keyword parameters with defaults
- **&allow-other-keys**: flag only

**Limitations**:
- ❌ NO `&whole` support (must be first in CL)
- ❌ NO `&environment` support (can appear anywhere)
- Simple destructuring only in compile-defmacro (lines 382-409)
- Lacks sophisticated destructuring that exists in destructuring.lisp

---

## 4. Existing &whole/&environment Support

**File 1**: `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/lib/destructuring.lisp` (468 lines)
- **Status**: COMPLETE implementation for destructuring-bind
- **Features**:
  - Full `&whole` support (lines 192-206) - MUST be first
  - Nested destructuring patterns
  - Complex `&optional` and `&key` handling
  - Proper error messages
- **NOT currently used by macro.lisp**

**File 2**: `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/lib/setf-expanders.lisp` (lines 153-170)
- **Status**: References `&environment` parameter
- **Usage**: `(define-setf-expander* accessor (form &environment env) body)`
- **Note**: Expects expanders to accept environment as last parameter

**The Gap**: macro.lisp has its own parse-lambda-list that ignores both destructuring.lisp and environment support needed for advanced macros.

---

## 5. WasmGC Types Used for Macros

**Location**: `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/compiler/codegen/gc-types.lisp`

**Current Type Indices** (allocated through type 23):
```
Type 0:  +type-nil+ (NIL singleton)
Type 1:  +type-unbound+ (UNBOUND sentinel)
Type 2:  +type-cons+ (cons cells)
Type 3:  +type-symbol+ (symbols)
Type 4:  +type-string+ (strings)
Type 5:  +type-closure+ (closures)
Type 6:  +type-instance+ (CLOS instances)
Type 7:  +type-standard-class+ (classes)
Type 8-12: +type-func-0+ through +type-func-n+ (function types)
Type 13: +type-binding-frame+ (dynamic binding frames)
Type 14: +type-bignum+ (arbitrary-precision integers)
Type 15: +type-ratio+ (exact rationals)
Type 16: +type-float+ (IEEE 754 doubles)
Type 17: +type-complex+ (complex numbers)
Type 18: +type-limb-array+ (bignum limbs)
Type 19: +type-stream+ (streams)
Type 20: +type-mv-array+ (multiple-value buffer)
Type 21: +type-slot-vector+ (CLOS slots / anyref arrays)
Type 22: +type-keyword-array+ (CLOS keywords)
Type 23: +type-closure-array+ (CLOS initform closures)
```

**Next Available**: Type indices 24+ reserved for macro-related types
- Would need: macro-expander struct, environment struct, etc.

---

## 6. How Macro Expansion Currently Works

### **Compile-Time Expansion** (macro.lisp lines 60-87):
```lisp
(defun macroexpand-1* (registry form)
  ;; Checks if form's car is a registered macro
  ;; Calls (funcall expander form)
  ;; Returns single-step expansion

(defun macroexpand* (registry form)
  ;; Repeatedly calls macroexpand-1* up to 1000 times
  ;; Detects macro-expansion-depth-exceeded
```

### **Defmacro Compilation** (lines 373-409):
```lisp
(defun compile-defmacro (result)
  ;; Creates lambda that:
  ;;   1. Takes the form being expanded
  ;;   2. Destructures (rest form) against lambda-list
  ;;   3. Creates bindings with quoted arguments
  ;;   4. Evaluates body in that environment via EVAL
  ;;   5. Returns the expanded form
```

### **Runtime Macro Expansion in Wasm** (func-section.lisp lines 4923-4969):
- **Current Status**: COMPILE-TIME ONLY
- **Implementation**: 
  - Checks if form is a quoted literal
  - If yes: expands at compile time using macroexpand-1*/macroexpand*
  - If no: returns form unchanged (no runtime expansion)
- **Comment** (line 4944): "No runtime expansion available - would require runtime macro registry"
- **Result**: Macros cannot be used in eval or inside compiled code

---

## 7. Gaps for &whole/&environment Support

| Feature | Current Status | Gap |
|---------|----------------|-----|
| **&whole binding** | ❌ Not in parse-lambda-list | Need to detect and bind complete form before destructuring |
| **&environment binding** | ❌ Not in parse-lambda-list | Need to create environment object and pass to macro body |
| **Macro lambda-list parsing** | Partial (destructuring.lisp exists but unused) | Integrate destructuring.lisp into macro.lisp |
| **Runtime macroexpand** | ❌ Only compile-time | Need Wasm-level macro registry and lookup |
| **Environment object type** | ❌ Not defined | Need WasmGC struct for runtime environment capture |
| **Macro function wrapper** | Basic (lines 382-409) | Need to handle &whole before destructuring, pass &environment |
| **Two-value return** | ❌ Not implemented | macroexpand needs to return (values expanded-form did-expand-p) |

---

## 8. Defmacro Count in Clysm Source

**Total**: 27 defmacro definitions found in `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/src/clysm/`

**Files with defmacro**:
1. `lib/macros.lisp` - 7 macros (when*, unless*, cond*, dolist*, dotimes*, and*, or*)
2. `lib/setf-expanders.lisp` - 2 macros (define-setf-expander*, defsetf*)
3. `lib/package-macros.lisp` - 2 macros (in-package*, defpackage*)
4. `ffi/macros.lisp` - 2 macros (define-foreign-function, export-function)
5. `filesystem/macros.lisp` - 1 macro (with-open-file*)
6. `filesystem/ffi.lisp` - 1 macro (with-file-error-translation)
7. `conditions/handlers.lisp` - 2 macros (handler-case, handler-bind)
8. `conditions/restarts.lisp` - 3 macros (restart-case, restart-bind, with-simple-restart)
9. `runtime/condition-runtime.lisp` - 2 macros (with-handler-cluster, with-restart-cluster)
10. `stage1/logging.lisp` - 4 macros (log-debug, log-info, log-warn, log-error)
11. `eval/compile.lisp` - 1 macro (tiered-function-wrapper)

**None currently use &whole or &environment** - this is where Feature 042 will have impact.

---

## 9. Summary: Implementation Path for Feature 042

**Phase 1: Enhance parse-lambda-list**
- Add `&whole` detection (must be first)
- Add `&environment` detection (anywhere)
- Leverage destructuring.lisp patterns

**Phase 2: Update compile-defmacro**
- Bind whole-form before destructuring
- Create and pass environment object
- Support two-value return (expanded-form did-expand-p)

**Phase 3: Define WasmGC Environment Type**
- Create `$macro-environment` struct (type 24)
- Fields: macro-registry, symbol-macros, etc.
- Runtime marshalling between compile-time and Wasm

**Phase 4: Implement Runtime Macro Expansion**
- Emit macro registry as Wasm global
- Implement `macroexpand-1` and `macroexpand` in Wasm IR
- Support both compile-time and runtime invocation

**Phase 5: Self-Compilation Testing**
- Compile all 27 defmacro forms
- Verify &whole/&environment usage works
- Measure compilation rate improvement

---

All file paths are absolute and based on: `/home/user/src/clysm-workbench/clysm3/`

input.content:
# Implementation Plan: Advanced Defmacro and Compile-Time Macro Expansion

**Branch**: `042-advanced-defmacro` | **Date**: 2025-12-28 | **Spec**: [spec.md](./spec.md)
**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/042-advanced-defmacro/spec.md`

## Summary

Implement advanced `defmacro` features including `&whole` (complete macro call form access) and `&environment` (lexical environment access) parameters, plus runtime `macroexpand`/`macroexpand-1` functions in compiled Wasm code. This extends the existing Feature 016 macro system to achieve full ANSI CL compliance and enable self-compilation of Clysm's 27 `defmacro` definitions.

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: Common Lisp (SBCL 2.4+) - compiler implementation; WasmGC - output target
**Primary Dependencies**: alexandria, babel, trivial-gray-streams, rove (testing); existing clysm/compiler (Feature 016 macro system), clysm/lib/destructuring (Feature 031)
**Storage**: N/A (in-memory macro registry, WasmGC globals for runtime)
**Testing**: rove (unit/contract/integration), wasm-tools validate
**Target Platform**: WasmGC (browsers with GC proposal support, wasmtime)
**Project Type**: Single - compiler extension
**Performance Goals**: Macro expansion <1ms per form, runtime macroexpand <10ms for 100-form chain
**Constraints**: No linear memory access, WasmGC-only types, ANSI CL compliance
**Scale/Scope**: 27 defmacro forms in Clysm source, 1000-step circular expansion limit

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

| Principle | Status | Evidence |
|-----------|--------|----------|
| I. WasmGC-First | PASS | Environment struct uses WasmGC types (anyref fields), no linear memory |
| II. Lisp Object Representation | PASS | NIL/UNBOUND handling preserved, macro registry uses symbol keys |
| III. Closure Implementation | PASS | Macro expanders are closures with $code_1 (form arg) |
| IV. Wasm Control Flow | PASS | No control flow changes needed for macro expansion |
| V. Shallow Binding | N/A | Macros are compile-time, no dynamic scope interaction |
| VI. Tiered Eval/JIT | PASS | Runtime macroexpand integrates with Tier 1 interpreter |

# Implementation Plan: Advanced Defmacro and Compile-Time Macro Expansion

**Branch**: `042-advanced-defmacro` | **Date**: 2025-12-28 | **Spec**: [spec.md](./spec.md)
**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/042-advanced-defmacro/spec.md`

## Summary

Implement advanced `defmacro` features including `&whole` (complete macro call form access) and `&environment` (lexical environment access) parameters, plus runtime `macroexpand`/`macroexpand-1` functions in compiled Wasm code. This extends the existing Feature 016 macro system to achieve full ANSI CL compliance and enable self-compilation of Clysm's 27 `defmacro` definitions.

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: Common Lisp (SBCL 2.4+) - compiler implementation; WasmGC - output target
**Primary Dependencies**: alexandria, babel, trivial-gray-streams, rove (testing); existing clysm/compiler (Feature 016 macro system), clysm/lib/destructuring (Feature 031)
**Storage**: N/A (in-memory macro registry, WasmGC globals for runtime)
**Testing**: rove (unit/contract/integration), wasm-tools validate
**Target Platform**: WasmGC (browsers with GC proposal support, wasmtime)
**Project Type**: Single - compiler extension
**Performance Goals**: Macro expansion <1ms per form, runtime macroexpand <10ms for 100-form chain
**Constraints**: No linear memory access, WasmGC-only types, ANSI CL compliance
**Scale/Scope**: 27 defmacro forms in Clysm source, 1000-step circular expansion limit

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

| Principle | Status | Evidence |
|-----------|--------|----------|
| I. WasmGC-First | PASS | Environment struct uses WasmGC types (anyref fields), no linear memory |
| II. Lisp Object Representation | PASS | NIL/UNBOUND handling preserved, macro registry uses symbol keys |
| III. Closure Implementation | PASS | Macro expanders are closures with $code_1 (form arg) |
| IV. Wasm Control Flow | PASS | No control flow changes needed for macro expansion |
| V. Shallow Binding | N/A | Macros are compile-time, no dynamic scope interaction |
| VI. Tiered Eval/JIT | PASS | Runtime macroexpand integrates with Tier 1 interpreter |
| VII. TDD (Non-negotiable) | PASS | Test files defined for each phase before implementation |
| VIII. Nix-First | PASS | No new external dependencies, uses existing devShell tools |

**Gate Result**: PASS - Proceed to Phase 0
